channel.title: A few questions dealing with npc's and objects
channel.description:
I have a few questions about autospawn, npc's, and world objects. Please answer them if you can :)
Ok first, I wanted to know how you spawn an npc, so he is stationary. I know that you go into autospawnand then add him to the list, with his id and stuff, but when I compile, and then turn my server on, the server messes up, and it won't log in. So could you tell me how to correctly autospawn an npc.
Ok, the other question: I was wondering how you make, say like, a bank appear. When I go into global objects, and insert the numbers and compile, then turn my server on, the bank is not there, as if i never typed it into the global objects thing.
Ok that's about it. Thx for your time. \

item.title: A few questions dealing with npc's and objects
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

  1. spawn = #### $$$$ %%%% 0 0 0 0 0 1

Look the #### = the npc id
$$$$ = The absX of the npc.
%%%% = The absY of the npc

0 0 0 0 0 means that he doesnt walk and stand only.

  1. go to makeglobalobjects

        makeGlobalObject(####, $$$$, ****, 0, 10);

= absX of object.

$$$$ = absY of object
**** = Object

Read full topic
item.source: A few questions dealing with npc's and objects

item.title: A few questions dealing with npc's and objects
item.dc:creator: @cj_own_u cj own u
item.description:
@cj_own_u wrote:

I have a few questions about autospawn, npc’s, and world objects. Please answer them if you can

Ok first, I wanted to know how you spawn an npc, so he is stationary. I know that you go into autospawnand then add him to the list, with his id and stuff, but when I compile, and then turn my server on, the server messes up, and it won’t log in. So could you tell me how to correctly autospawn an npc.

Ok, the other question: I was wondering how you make, say like, a bank appear. When I go into global objects, and insert the numbers and compile, then turn my server on, the bank is not there, as if i never typed it into the global objects thing.

Ok that’s about it. Thx for your time. \
